clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Therapeutic Vaccination With Intensified Schedule Plus Pegasys Dual Therapy on Chronic Hepatitis B Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Phase4, to Compare Efficacy and Safety of Therapeutic Vaccination With Intensified Schedule Plus Pegylated Interferon Dual Therapy on Seroclearance of HBS Antigen in Patients With Complete Virological Response Induced by Entecavir

oversight_info.authority: Korea: Ministry of Food and Drug Safety

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized, Open label, Single center, Prospective study to compare efficacy and safety of Therapeutic Vaccination with Intensified schedule plus Pegylated Interferon dual Therapy on Seroclearance of Hepatitis B virus Surface Antigen in Patients with Complete Virological Response Induced by Entecavir

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, Open label, Single center, Prospective study to compare efficacy and safety of Therapeutic Vaccination with Intensified schedule plus Pegylated Interferon dual Therapy on Seroclearance of Hepatitis B virus Surface Antigen in Patients with Complete Virological Response Induced by Entecavir (E + VIP)

primary_outcome.description: The rate of HBsAg-seroclearance at the time point of at weeks 72 in the concomitant treatment group and at weeks 100 in the sequential treatment group (24 weeks after termination of treatment)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The rate of HBsAg-seroconversion at weeks 72
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of HBsAg-seroconversion at weeks 72 in theconcomitant treatment group and at weeks 100 in the sequential treatment group

secondary_outcome.measure: The Change of HBsAg level from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The Change of HBsAg level from baseline at weeks 72
secondary_outcome.description: The Change of HBsAg level from baseline at weeks 72 in the concomitant treatment group and at weeks 100 in the sequential treatment group

arm_group.description: Peginterferon alfa-2a: once weekly 180 μg subcutaneous injection for 48 weeks HBV vaccination (Euvax B Inj): 1.0 mL (20 μg) intramuscular injection at 4, 8, 12 and 28 weeks Continue Entecavir(0.5mg) for 100 weeks(once daily)

Peginterferon alfa-2a: once weekly 180 μg or weight base dose subcutaneous injection for 48 weeks HBV vaccination (Euvax B Inj): 1.0 mL (20 μg) intramuscular injection at 52, 56, 60 and 76 weeks Continue Entecavir(0.5mg) for 100 weeks(once daily)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. age between 20 and 75 year-old
2. HBsAg-positive for > 6 months apart (medical history can be alternative)
3. currently being treated with entecavir 0.5 mg/day for more than 24 months
4. undetectable HBV DNA in serum (<20IU/mL) and HBeAg-negative for > 1year
5. HBsAg titer < 3,000 IU/mL
6. ALT<300IU/L
7. Subject must be willing to give written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with decompensated liver cirrhosis
- serum bilirubin > 3 mg/dL
- prothrombin time > 6 seconds prolonged or INR >2.3
- serum albumin < 2.8 g/dL
- History of ascites, variceal hemorrhage, or hepatic encephalopathy
- Child-Pugh score ≥7 (Child-Pugh class B or C)
2. Patients who were treated with interferon or nucleos(t)ide analogues other than Entecavir
3. Patients who have evidence of renal insufficiency defined as serum creatinine>1.5 mg/dL
4. Patients with psychological problem including uncontrolled depression
5. Patients who have previous/current significant co-morbidities including congestive heart failure, chronic kidney disease, hematologic disease and malignancy (including hepatocellular carcinoma)
6. Patients with seropositivity for anti-HCV, anti-HDV, or anti-HIV
7. Patients who have excessive alcohol consumption (> 30 g/day)
8. Patients who have evidence of autoimmune hepatitis, hemochromatosis or Wilson's disease
9. Pregnant or breast feeding females
10. Patients with disease may deteriorate with interferon therapy(eg, autoimmune thyroiditis)
11. Concomitant treatment and previous organ transplantation recipients
12. Subject who the investigator deems inappropriate to participate in this study
